definition: bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Is here a bus stop near by?
sentences.chinese: 我想问问附近有没有公车站？

sentences.english: Steven was tardy this morning and alleges that his bus was late.
sentences.chinese: 芬今天早上迟到的说词是公车误点了。

sentences.english: The poor boy was named during a streetcar strike in New Orleans in 1929.
sentences.chinese: 穷小子在1929年新奥尔良公车罢工期间得名。

sentences.english: But there's a bus every ten minutes, and you are over 1 hour late.
sentences.chinese: 但是每十分钟就有一班公车，你迟到一个多钟了。

sentences.english: She takes the bus to work, whereas I take the subway.
sentences.chinese: 她搭公车上班，而我则搭地铁。

sentences.english: Is it your ? rst time taking the bus?
sentences.chinese: 这是你第一次搭公车吗？

sentences.english: Drive faster and try to catch up with that bus.
sentences.chinese: 开快一点，想办法赶上公车。

sentences.english: But one month later, the bus conductor was murdered too.
sentences.chinese: 但二个月后，公车售票员也被谋杀了。

sentences.english: I was in a hurry and got on the wrong bus.
You or I am to go to the bus stop.
sentences.chinese: 你或者是我将去公车站。

sentences.english: A bus conductor caught the criminal.
sentences.chinese: 一个公车售票员抓住了罪犯。

sentences.english: Once carried a bag, the boy stood at the platform, listened to the music quietly.
sentences.chinese: 曾经背着书包，站在站台，安静听歌等公车的男孩。

sentences.english: I found that when I rode the bus, my commute would be perhaps an hour.
sentences.chinese: 我发现我坐公车的时候，也许会花上一个小时。

sentences.english: Emma: We can't take the public bus because we're still quite a distance from Kenting.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能搭公车，因为到垦丁还很远。

sentences.english: There is another bus right behind this one.
sentences.chinese: 下一辆公车随后就会到。

sentences.english: And all this started in the bus slams on the breaks.
sentences.chinese: 而这一切开始于公车由于刹车而侧翻。

definition: public transportation/mass transit/abbr. for 公共交通[gong1 gong4 jiao1 tong1]
to take the car, bus, train etc
special (or reserved) train (or bus etc)/limousine/private car used as a taxi and booked via a smartphone app
unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
